sources.title: They Can't Hang Me
sources.description: Title: They Can't Hang Me Summary: A senior civil servant is condemned to hang for murder but he claims to have top secret security information... Directed by: Val Guest Actors: Terence Morgan, Yolande Donlan, André Morell Production Company: Vandyke Pictures Release Date: October 1955 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Sentenced to death for murder, a civil servant reveals that he has long been a foreign agent smuggling secrets out of the country. He meets with special branch officer Inspector Brown and offers to reveal the identity of an elusive master spy in return for a reprieve. With five days before Pitt is to be hung, Brown sets out to trace the identity of the spy without having to reprieve Pitt.

metadata.Plot: Sentenced to death for murder, a civil servant reveals that he has long been a foreign agent smuggling secrets out of the country. He meets with special branch officer Inspector Brown and offers to reveal the identity of an elusive master spy in return for a reprieve. With five days before Pitt is to be hanged, Brown sets out to trace the identity of the spy without having to offer Pitt a reprieve.
metadata.Writer: Val Guest, Val Valentine, Leonard Mosley
metadata.Actors: Terence Morgan, Yolande Donlan, André Morell
